com.googlecode.prmf.merapi.util.iterators
Class IteratorAdapter<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.prmf.merapi.util.iterators.AbstractUniversalIterator<T>
      com.googlecode.prmf.merapi.util.iterators.IteratorAdapter<T>
Type Parameters:
T - type over which the iteration takes place
All Implemented Interfaces:
UniversalIterator<T>, Iterable<T>, Enumeration<T>, Iterator<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
JEnumerationAdapter, JIteratorAdapter, LineIterator
public abstract class IteratorAdapter<T>
extends AbstractUniversalIterator<T>

Abstract adapter for iterators and other objects that are conceptually iterable.

Java's iterator combines into one the Gang of Four iterator's retrieve current element and advance operations. Other structures over which it may be desirable to iterate have analogous methods, such as BufferedReader's readLine(). This class aims to reduce code duplication in adapters for all these structures by providing a flexible common skeleton.

Subclasses should implement doAdvance(), using setCurrent(Object) and markAsDone() for state changes. There is no need to check if the iterator is done from within doAdvance(), as this check is already made in this class.

They should also call init() from within their constructors so the iterator is valid. This requirement of the contract is not explicitly enforced at this time, so run your tests.

Author:
Miorel-Lucian Palii

Method Detail

init

protected void init()
Initializes the adapter. May retrieve one element from the adaptee as a side effect.

advance

public final void advance()
Retrieves the next element and prepares it to be returned by calls to current().

doAdvance

protected abstract void doAdvance()
Does the actual work of advancing this iterator.

markAsDone

protected void markAsDone()
Marks this iterator as done. In other words, marks it such that subsequent calls to isDone() will return true.

setCurrent

protected void setCurrent(T element)
Sets the current element to the specified value.

Parameters:
element - the new current element

current

public T current()
Retrieves the current element in the traversal represented by this iterator.

Returns:
the current element in the traversal

isDone

public boolean isDone()
Checks whether this iterator has exhausted all the elements of its underlying traversal.

Returns:
whether all elements have been exhausted

isFresh

protected boolean isFresh()
Checks whether this is a "fresh" iterator. Calls to advance() will set this to false. Newly-created iterators are expected to return true from this method.

Returns:
whether this iterator is "fresh"

reset

public void reset()
           throws IllegalStateException
Does nothing in a newly-created iterator, otherwise throws an IllegalStateException.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the iterator isn't "fresh"
